According to our research of Indiana and other state lists, there were 10 registered sex offenders living in Westfield, Indiana as of August 25, 2024.

The ratio of all residents to sex offenders in Westfield is 3,451 to 1.

The ratio of registered sex offenders to all residents in this city is much lower than the state average.

Tornado activity:

Westfield-area historical tornado activity is slightly above Indiana state average. It is 126% greater than the overall U.S. average.

On 4/11/1965, a category F4 (max. wind speeds 207-260 mph) tornado 11.1 miles away from the Westfield town center killed 28 people and injured 123 people and caused between $5,000,000 and $50,000,000 in damages.

On 5/14/1972, a category F4 tornado 18.3 miles away from the town center injured 20 people and caused between $50,000 and $500,000 in damages.

Earthquake activity:

Westfield-area historical earthquake activity is significantly above Indiana state average. It is 71% greater than the overall U.S. average.

On 4/18/2008 at 09:36:59, a magnitude 5.4 (5.1 MB, 4.8 MS, 5.4 MW, 5.2 MW, Class: Moderate, Intensity: VI - VII) earthquake occurred 144.2 miles away from the city center

On 4/18/2008 at 09:36:59, a magnitude 5.2 (5.2 MW, Depth: 8.9 mi) earthquake occurred 144.3 miles away from Westfield center

On 6/10/1987 at 23:48:54, a magnitude 5.1 (4.9 MB, 4.4 MS, 4.6 MS, 5.1 LG) earthquake occurred 125.8 miles away from Westfield center

On 7/27/1980 at 18:52:21, a magnitude 5.2 (5.1 MB, 4.7 MS, 5.0 UK, 5.2 UK) earthquake occurred 172.4 miles away from Westfield center

On 6/18/2002 at 17:37:15, a magnitude 5.0 (4.3 MB, 4.6 MW, 5.0 LG) earthquake occurred 167.0 miles away from Westfield center

On 4/18/2008 at 15:14:16, a magnitude 4.8 (4.5 MB, 4.8 MW, 4.6 MW, Class: Light, Intensity: IV - V) earthquake occurred 141.6 miles away from Westfield center

Magnitude types: regional Lg-wave magnitude (LG), body-wave magnitude (MB), surface-wave magnitude (MS), moment magnitude (MW)

2002 - 2017 National Fire Incident Reporting System (NFIRS) incidents

Based on the data from the years 2002 - 2017 the average number of fires per year is 66. The highest number of reported fires - 100 took place in 2010, and the least - 32 in 2014. The data has a rising trend.

When looking into fire subcategories, the most incidents belonged to: Structure Fires (43.8%), and Outside Fires (40.9%).
